ui.datastores.title: Data Stores
ui.datastores.subtitle: Configure S3 storage buckets for your application data
ui.datastore.wizard.page_description: A data store is a secure cloud storage for files. When you create a datastore, a bucket will be created on AWS S3 to host your files.
ui.datastore.wizard.step1_name_question: What is the name of your data store?
ui.datastore.wizard.step1_name_hint: The only special character allowed is a hyphen (-).
ui.datastore.wizard.step1_region_questio: Which geographic location would you like the data store?
ui.datastore.wizard.step1_region_hint: Choose a region close to your users for better performance.
ui.datastore.wizard.step2_acl_question: Which ACL do you want to use?
ui.datastore.wizard.step2_acl_hint: If uncertain, use 'private' for maximum security.
ui.datastore.wizard.step2_acl_private_de: Only you and authorized users can access files
ui.datastore.wizard.step2_acl_public_rea: Anyone can read files, but only you can write
ui.datastore.wizard.step2_acl_public_rw_: Anyone can read and write files (not recommended)
ui.datastore.wizard.step2_acl_auth_read_: Only authenticated AWS users can read files
ui.datastore.wizard.step2_block_question: Do you wish to block all public access?
ui.datastore.wizard.step2_block_hint: This will override any public ACLs above for maximum security.
ui.datastore.wizard.step2_block_no_desc: Use with caution - enables public file access
ui.datastore.wizard.step3_description: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) policies control which domains can access your data store from web browsers. This is essential for file uploads from web applications.
ui.datastore.wizard.step3_no_cors_desc: Add CORS policies to enable cross-origin requests to your data store.
ui.datastore.wizard.final_success_title: Your data store has been created!
ui.datastore.wizard.final_success_desc: Your secure cloud storage is now ready to use. You can start uploading files and configuring your applications to use this data store.
ui.config.title: Application Configuration
ui.config.subtitle: Manage your application settings
ui.config.sidebar.title: Configuration
ui.config.user_table.title: User Table Configuration
ui.config.user_table.description: Customize the user table for your web app. Specify the fields and attributes that define your users, such as name, email, and password. This allows you to tailor the user management system to fit your specific requirements.
ui.config.language.title: Application Language
ui.config.language.description: Set the default language for your application. This language will be used for all users who haven't set their own language preference.
ui.config.language.note_text: Individual users can override this setting in their personal profile settings.
ui.config.language.label: Default Language
ui.config.org_table.title: Organization Table Configuration
ui.config.org_table.description: Set up an organization table to manage users within specific groups or organizations. Define fields like organization name, description, and membership attributes to organize users and facilitate collaboration within your web app.
ui.config.aws.title: AWS Credentials
ui.config.aws.description: AWS credentials configured for this application. These credentials are used for accessing AWS services required by your application.
ui.config.aws.secret_hidden: Secret key is not displayed for security
ui.config.aws.note_text: Currently, changing AWS credentials for your application is not supported. If you need to change AWS credentials, please contact support.
ui.config.env_vars.title: Environment Variables
ui.config.env_vars.description: Manage your application's environment variables here. Add new variables, edit existing ones, or remove them as needed. Ensure to follow the correct format and understand the impact of changes on your application's behavior.
ui.config.kyte_connect.obfuscation.title: Kyte Connect Obfuscation
ui.config.kyte_connect.obfuscation.descr: Control whether JavaScript for connecting to the Kyte API endpoint is obfuscated. Obfuscation is recommended for security, but if organizational policies (such as firewall requirements) prevent obfuscated code, you can disable it here.
ui.config.kyte_connect.obfuscation.impor: Changing this setting will automatically regenerate the Kyte Connect code and update all published pages with the new version. You can review the updated code in the "Kyte Connect Code Comparison" section below before it's applied.
ui.config.kyte_connect.comparison.title: Kyte Connect Code Comparison
ui.config.kyte_connect.comparison.descri: Compare your current Kyte Connect JavaScript with the latest system version. Update your application to use the latest code when API endpoints or configurations change.

ui.emails.subtitle: Create custom email templates for robust and captivating emails for your app.

ui.component_editor.settings.placeholder: Describe the purpose and usage of this component
ui.component_editor.sample_data.title: Sample Data for Testing
ui.component_editor.sample_data.descript: Define sample data as a JSON array to test your component with realistic values. The preview will render multiple instances using this data.
ui.component_editor.quick_test.title: Quick Test - Multiple Instances
ui.component_editor.quick_test.descripti: See how your component looks with multiple instances side-by-side
ui.component_editor.help.title: Web Component Help & Documentation
ui.component_editor.help.what.title: What are Web Components?
ui.component_editor.help.what.descriptio: Web Components are reusable HTML+CSS templates that can be dynamically populated with data. They use mustache-style placeholders for dynamic content.
ui.component_editor.help.syntax.title: Placeholder Syntax
ui.component_editor.help.syntax.descript: Use double curly braces to create placeholders in your HTML:
ui.component_editor.help.usage.title: Using in Your Application
ui.component_editor.help.usage.descripti: Load and use your component with kyte-api-js:
ui.component_editor.help.usage.note: Use the "Get Code" button for component-specific code you can copy.
ui.component_editor.help.css.title: CSS Scoping Tips
ui.component_editor.help.css.tip1: Use unique class names to avoid conflicts
ui.component_editor.help.css.tip2: Component CSS is injected inline with HTML
ui.component_editor.help.css.tip3: Consider using a prefix for your component classes (e.g., .card-component-title)
ui.component_editor.help.resources.title: Additional Resources
ui.component_editor.modal.get_code.title: Component Usage Code
ui.component_editor.modal.import.title: Import Component
ui.component_editor.modal.import.descrip: Upload a JSON file exported from another component to import it.
ui.component_editor.snapshot.tooltip: Take preview snapshot for gallery view

ui.cron.subtitle: Manage scheduled background jobs with automatic retry, version control, and monitoring
ui.cron.wizard.title: Create Cron Job

ui.cron.wizard.schedule_question: How often should this job run?
ui.cron.wizard.schedule.interval_desc: Best for most jobs - run every X seconds/minutes/hours
ui.cron.wizard.schedule.daily_desc: Run once every day at a specific time
ui.cron.wizard.schedule.weekly_desc: Run once per week on a specific day and time
ui.cron.wizard.schedule.monthly_desc: Run once per month on a specific day
ui.cron.wizard.interval.label: Run every
ui.cron.wizard.monthly.day_hint: Day 1-31 (if day doesn't exist in month, last day will be used)

ui.site_detail.domain.title: Custom Domain
ui.site_detail.domain.add_description: Configure a custom domain for your site instead of using the default CloudFront domain.
ui.site_detail.domain.enter_hint: Enter your domain name without https://
ui.site_detail.domain.add_dns_records: Add the following DNS records to validate your domain:
ui.site_detail.domain.dns_step1: Copy the records above - Use the copy buttons for accuracy
ui.site_detail.domain.dns_step2: Log into your DNS provider (Cloudflare, Route53, GoDaddy, etc.)
ui.site_detail.domain.dns_step3: Add each CNAME record - Name → Target as shown above
ui.site_detail.domain.dns_step4: Save changes - TTL can be 300 seconds or Auto
ui.site_detail.domain.dns_step5: Wait for validation - Usually 5-30 minutes, max 24 hours
ui.site_detail.domain.generating_hint: This usually takes 30-60 seconds. We'll refresh automatically.
ui.site_detail.domain.active_description: Your SSL certificate is valid and your domain is ready to use.
ui.site_detail.domain.failed_description: We couldn't validate your domain. This could be due to:
ui.site_detail.domain.failed_reason2: Domain not pointing to the correct nameservers
ui.site_detail.domain.pending_descriptio: We're validating your domain. This typically takes 5-10 minutes.
ui.site_detail.domain.auto_refresh: We'll automatically refresh when validation completes
ui.site_detail.settings.title: Site Settings
ui.site_detail.settings.alias_descriptio: Configure an alternative domain for your site
ui.site_detail.settings.language_descrip: Sets the default language for the site. Can be overridden at a per page level when a page specific language is configured.
ui.site_detail.settings.ga_description: Enter your Google Analytics tracking ID to enable analytics for this site
ui.site_detail.settings.gtm_description: Enter your Google Tag Manager container ID for advanced tracking

ui.site_detail.navigation.sticky_yes: Yes - Stick to top when scrolling
ui.site_detail.navigation.sticky_hint: Make navigation bar stick to top when scrolling
ui.site_detail.navigation.preview_hint: Preview updates as you change colors above
ui.site_detail.navigation.name_hint: This name is used to identify the navigation menu in the admin panel
ui.site_detail.navigation.page_option: Select page for navbar title/logo click...
ui.site_detail.navigation.page_hint: Page to navigate to when the navbar title/logo is clicked
ui.site_detail.navigation.logo_hint: Select a logo image from your media library. Leave blank to use text-based brand name
ui.site_detail.navigation.tip_text: You can set a specific page for users to navigate to when they click on your site's logo or title in the navigation bar.
ui.site_detail.navigation.no_menu_descri: Select a navigation menu from the dropdown above, or create a new one.

ui.site_detail.sidenav.tip_text: Side navigation menus are perfect for creating vertical navigation panels that can be embedded in your page layouts.

ui.page_wizard.step_1.page_type_label: What kind of page are you creating?
ui.page_wizard.step_1.customization_note: Further customization is available even after selection.
ui.page_wizard.step_2.path_label: What is the path to your page?
ui.page_wizard.step_2.path_description: This will be what you see in the URL.
ui.page_wizard.step_2.requires_login_lab: Does your page require users to be logged in to view it?
ui.page_wizard.step_2.sitemap_label: Would you like to include this page in the sitemap for crawlers to index?
ui.page_wizard.step_2.sitemap_note: Recommended if SEO and site visibility is important.
ui.page_wizard.step_2.navigation_label: Does your page require a main navigation bar?
ui.page_wizard.step_3.title_label: Pick a user and search engine friendly title

ui.page_wizard.step_3.description_placeh: This page helps users manage their account settings and preferences...
ui.page_wizard.step_3.description_note: You can skip the description if you require your users to login to view the page you are about to create.
ui.page_wizard.step_4.login.heading_labe: Give your login page a heading

ui.page_wizard.step_4.login.redirect_lab: After login, where should your users be directed to?

ui.page_wizard.step_4.table.row_click_la: Where should users be directed when they click a row?
ui.page_wizard.step_4.table.columns_desc: All columns are included by default. To exclude any from your table, drag them over to the exclude area.
ui.page_wizard.step_4.table.fields_descr: Drag fields to their desired location. Fields will expand to fill the width if less than four columns are used.
ui.page_wizard.step_4.custom.sidenav_lab: Does your page have a side navigation?

ui.script_editor.setting_global_descript: Configure whether this script should be loaded on all pages globally throughout your site.
ui.script_editor.setting_module_descript: Configure whether this script should be loaded as an ES6 module.
ui.script_editor.setting_obfuscate_descr: Enable obfuscation to protect your JavaScript code from being easily readable.

ui.config.ai_error.estimated_cost_toolti: This is an estimated cost based on token usage. AWS Bedrock pricing may vary. Please check your AWS Billing Console for actual costs.
ui.config.ai_error.enable_ai_desc: Master toggle for the entire system
ui.config.ai_error.enable_auto_fix_desc: Automatically apply high-confidence fixes (default: suggest only)
ui.config.ai_error.min_confidence_desc: Only fixes with confidence above this threshold will be auto-applied
ui.config.ai_error.cooldown_period_desc: Wait time before re-analyzing same error
ui.config.ai_error.loop_window_desc: Time window for detecting recurring errors
ui.config.ai_error.auto_disable_loop_des: Automatically disable auto-fix when infinite loop detected
ui.config.ai_error.batch_size_desc: Max analyses per cron job run
